variant.title: Sixth Web as Corpus Workshop (WAC-6) Proceedings of the Workshop
variant.note: June 5, 2010 Los Angeles, California USB memory sticks produced by Omnipress Inc. 2600 Anderson Street Madison, WI 53707 USA
variant.affiliation: c�2010 The Association for Computational Linguistics Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)
variant.address: 209 N. Eighth Street Stroudsburg, PA 18360 USA Tel: +1-570-476-8006 Fax: +1-570-476-0860
variant.bodyText: More and more people are using Web data for linguistic and NLP research. The workshop, the sixth in an annual series, provides a venue for exploring how we can use it effectively and what we will find if we do, with particular attention to
variant.listItem: • Web corpus collection projects, or modules for one part of the process (crawling, filtering, de- duplication, language-id, tokenising, indexing, ... ) • characteristics of Web data from a linguistics/NLP perspective including registers, domains, frequency distributions, comparisons between datasets • using crawled Web data for NLP purposes (with emphasis on the data rather than the use)
variant.bodyText: Previous WAC workshops have been in Europe and Africa. The west coast of the US is the global centre for web development, hosting Google, Microsoft, Yahoo and a thousand others, so we are glad to be here! iii
